sentences.en: An oppressive silence fell upon the room.
sentences.cn: 死样的沉默压在这书房里.

sentences.en: By midday the irk of his pack became too oppressive.
sentences.cn: 走到中午的时候,累赘的包袱压得他受不了.

sentences.en: Confusion sets in as functions lose their sharp edges , and navigation becomes oppressive.
sentences.cn: 由此产生的困扰可以让宝剑失去锋芒, 人们无法忍受这样的浏览导航.

sentences.en: He felt it was a mockery, white, empty , oppressive.
sentences.cn: 他觉到一种嘲弄, 一种白的, 渺茫的, 闷气.

sentences.en: I rushed out of the room because the oppressive air stifled me.
sentences.cn: 我急忙地出了那个屋子,因为闷热的空气使我窒息起来.

sentences.en: If formed on equal and just principles, it cannot be oppressive.
sentences.cn: 只要能依公平及平等的原则来组织, 它将不致有压迫性.

sentences.en: My desire to be rich was an insane, unwholesome, oppressive desire.
sentences.cn: 我对财富的渴望疯狂、病态，犹如心头的一块重石。

sentences.en: Oh, how oppressive this continual delirium is.
sentences.cn: 啊, 这种连续的昏迷是多么痛苦啊!

sentences.en: She had an oppressive air of expecting subtle things of them.
sentences.cn: 她经常摆出一副咄咄逼人的气势,象是要找他们的岔儿.

sentences.en: The air had been stale and oppressive; now fresh winds were blowing.
sentences.cn: 曾经是混浊不堪和令人窒息的空气, 此时吹来阵阵清风.

sentences.en: The new laws will be just as oppressive as those they replace.
sentences.cn: 新法律只会与原来的法律一样苛严。

sentences.en: The oppressive afternoon heat had quite tired him out.
sentences.cn: 下午令人难耐的高温让他完全精疲力竭。

sentences.en: the oppressive heat of the afternoon
To his own people, Solomon was a wasteful and oppressive monarch.
sentences.cn: 对他本国人民来说, 所罗门是个挥霍、残暴的君主.

sentences.en: We were passing the dreary and oppressive winter.
sentences.cn: 我们正在渡过那灰暗又艰苦的冬天.

words.tran_cn: 压抑；镇压；压迫手段；沉闷；苦恼
压迫，压抑；使……烦恼；使……感到沉重

trans.tran_cn: 沉重的，压迫的，压抑的，沉闷
trans.tran_en: If you describe a society, its laws, or customs as oppressive, you think they treat people cruelly and unfairly
